intro: Epilobium pylaieanum, commonly known as the yellow willow herb, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and typically grows in moist, well-drained soils along stream banks and woodland edges. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often reddish in color. It is often used in herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
